parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To increase exceedingly or beyond measure. From huper and auzano; to increase above ordinary degree.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleion; to do, make or be more, i.e. Increase; by extension, to superabound.
